item.title: Interaction effect in linear regession
item.description: Interpretation Interaction effect is important when we analyzing data. Suppose there is positive relationship between education and effort on test result. Furthermore, there is synergy effect between education and effort. Given high education, a unit increase in effort can lead to higher test result compared to those who has low education. \(test\_score=\beta_1 ×education+ \beta_2 × effort+ \beta_3 ×education×effort + \epsilon\) Taking derivative wrt education: \(\partial \ test\_score / \partial \ education =\beta_1 + \beta_3 ×effort\)

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This trial is for: This trial is for: This trial is for: \[e = mc^2\] Equation2: \(Anjari_{Dessianti}^{hms}\) Equation3: \(x^2 = 5x+1\) This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.
